title: Manage Post-Blast Fume Clearance
description: After a blast in an underground mine, a ventilation officer must ensure that toxic fumes (like NOx) are cleared before allowing personnel to re-enter the area.

tasks.description: After the blast is fired, monitor the gas sensors in the affected area.
tasks.expected_outcome: Real-time gas concentration data is displayed.

tasks.description: Wait for the gas concentrations to fall below the mandated re-entry limits.
tasks.expected_outcome: The system confirms when all gas levels are safe.

tasks.description: Once clear, give the 'all clear' signal, allowing personnel and equipment to re-enter the blast area.
tasks.expected_outcome: The all-clear is given, and normal operations resume.
